labels.analysis: The MCP Server serves as an integration layer between language models (LLMs) and external data/functional tools. Its core functionality is enabling dynamic interactions with real-world resources, allowing LLMs to execute actions and retrieve data from various sources in a standardized and secure manner. The provided tool "get_bmi" demonstrates this capability by performing a simple calculation based on user input, suggesting that the server can handle data processing and potentially more complex interactions with external systems.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "API Integration" was chosen because the server's primary purpose is to bridge LLMs with external data sources and functionalities through standardized interfaces. The secondary label "Data Analysis & Processing" was selected due to the included tool that performs calculations (BMI), indicating some data processing capability. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories cover the server's functionality well.

tools.name: get_bmi
tools.description: Calculate the BMI of a person given their height and weight

server_info_crawled.name: MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @hereisnitish/mcp-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Integrate your applications with external data and tools seamlessly. Enhance your workflows by allowing your language models to interact with real-world resources and perform actions dynamically. Experience a standardized and secure way to bridge your LLMs with various data sources and functionalities.

tools.name: get_bmi
tools.description: Calculate the BMI of a person given their height and weight

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@hereisnitish/mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
